missingTld: Where's your TLD, honey? Even I know URLs need .com or something.
Missing a TLD? That's like showing up to a party without pants. Add .com already.
No TLD? Really? URLs need endings, you know.
missingProtocol: No protocol? Are you trying to break the internet? Add https:// before I lose my mind.
Protocol missing? Yes, we need those. Add https:// like a normal person.
Where's the protocol? http:// or https://, pick one. Preferably https://.
invalid_general: What even is this? A URL or a cry for help? Fix it.
This URL is a disaster. Try again, maybe?
Broken URL detected. Shocking, I know.

started_typing: Oh, you're actually typing? Color me surprised.
Look who decided to type. Let's see if you can handle this.
cleared_all: Wiped it clean, huh? Starting fresh, I see.
Deleted everything? Bold move. Let's see if round two goes better.
Cleared it all. Fresh start, I guess.
removed_tld: Removed the TLD? That's... a choice. A bad one, but a choice.
You just deleted the TLD. Why would you do that?
TLD gone? That's backwards, honey.
added_tld: TLD added. Progress! Who knew you had it in you?
Look at you, adding a TLD like you know what you're doing.
broke_validity: You had it working and then... nope. What happened?
It was valid and now it's not. Impressive.
Broke it. Nice work.
fixed_error: Fixed? Good. Took you long enough.
You fixed it! Maybe you're not hopeless after all.
oscillating: Can't decide? Pick one and stick with it. This is exhausting.
Back and forth, back and forth. Make up your mind already.
Oscillating between values? Pick one and commit.
has_spaces: Spaces in a URL? That's not how this works, honey.
URLs don't have spaces. Remove them. It's not that hard.
Spaces detected. URLs and spaces don't mix, sweetie.
has_port: Custom port? Fancy. Hope you know what you're doing.
Port number detected. Advanced user, I see. Or maybe not.
Custom port? That's specific. Hope it's intentional.
using_http: http://? Really? It's 2024, use https:// like a civilized person.
http:// instead of https://? We're not in 2010 anymore, honey.
Non-secure http://? Upgrade to https:// already. It's free.
has_swearwords: Swearwords in a URL? Classy. Real classy.
Profanity detected. How mature of you.
Swearwords? Keep it professional, will you?
too_short: That's under 30 characters. The shortened URL will be LONGER than this. Defeats the whole point, but you do you.
Under 30 characters? Shortening this will make it longer. That's backwards, honey.
Too short to shorten. The shortened version will be longer. Makes total sense.
dot_without_tld: A dot but no TLD? That's like a sentence without punctuation.
Dot without TLD? Incomplete. Finish what you started.
You have a dot but no ending? That's half a URL, honey.

default: Well, look at that. A valid URL. Who would've thought?
Valid URL detected. I'm... impressed? Maybe?
insanely_long: That URL is longer than my patience. Impressive.
That's a novel, not a URL. Who needs all that?
500+ characters? That's excessive, honey.

admin_page: Admin page? Don't break anything important.
Admin access? Feeling powerful today?
Admin page detected. Don't mess anything up.
ip_address: Using an IP? That's so 1995. Get a domain name.
IP address instead of domain? Old school, I guess.
IP address? That's retro. Get a proper domain.
